Key Arguments: Free speech is fundamental to a free and open democracy.
Social media is the modern public square where everyone should have the right to express their views.
The definition of misinformation and disinformation is subjective, leading to potential censorship.
Existing criminal law is sufficient to protect citizens from harm without additional legislation.
Notable Quotes: "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it."
"I do not want this bill to pass in this or any other form. I do not consent to this covert censorship under threat of financial penalty."
